    • Uses of Box in chess

      Methods in chess that return Box 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Box[][] Board.initialize()
      Initialize the chess board to get ready for the game to start
      Box[][] Board.tempBoard​(Box[][] b, int oldx, int oldy, int newx, int newy)
      Creates a temporary chess board in order to test if a new move is legal.
      Methods in chess with parameters of type Box 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean Board.checkmate​(Box[][] b, int oldx, int oldy, int newx, int newy, boolean p)
      For every valid move the current player's king can make, check if the king is still under check after the move.
      int Board.move​(Box[][] board, int oldx, int oldy, int newx, int newy, boolean p)
      Check for invalid inputs Check for special move castling Check if the movement is legal If the movement is legal, check if current player's king is under check.
      int Board.opponentKingDead​(Box[][] newboard, int kingx, int kingy, int newx, int newy, boolean p)
      This method is used in the checkmate method.
      int Board.opponentUnderCheck​(Box[][] b, int oldx, int oldy, int newx, int newy, boolean p)
      After finding out your movement is legal, check if the move put the current player's king under check.
      void Board.printboard​(Box[][] board)
      Print out the chess board at the start of the game and every time a piece is moved
      Box[][] Board.tempBoard​(Box[][] b, int oldx, int oldy, int newx, int newy)
      Creates a temporary chess board in order to test if a new move is legal.
